content:
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, welcome. What can I do for you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hello sir
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Yes?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I have a denied transfer admission.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Bit I met assured admission req?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: What is wrong?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Let me check. Your name please?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Peter Parker.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK. Please wait. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Peter, I’ve checked your admission, it meets the “assured admission” of UH, but it does not meet the requirement of the major you wanted. For Cullen/Business, you need a 3.25 overall, compared to CLASS where you need a 2.5. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: I think you may consider changing your major and apply again. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK, thank you for your help.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hello, good morning. How may I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I am currently a student at UH College of Education. Want to transfer to the Bauer business school.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Sure. You can do that. May I know your name please? 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Daniel Smith. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I will have 34 credits at the end of this semester. The baser information site has confusing gpa requirements. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Daniel, it doesn’t matter. I will help you. Please wait. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: I checked that the transfer to Bauer business school needs 3.25 GPA
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Oh, but I should have a 3.0 GPA by the end of this semester.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Is this OK? Or should I wait till next semester and a higher gpa to change majors?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Sorry, I think Bauer business is pretty strict about the 3.25, as bauer is becoming more popular and respected. And you cannot change your major to pre-business after you hit 45 credits. So I think you may not be able to do that unless you can get 3.25 GPA by the end of this semester. Sorry for that. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Oh god. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Thanks anyway. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: You are welcome.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hello, Peter. This is advisor David. How can I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I’m an international student. I have received admission to UH and have been offered a research assistantship by a professor.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Great. Congrats. What’s your inquiry?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I am wondering if I should try to obtain an In-State Tuition waiver before classes begin.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I have learned that there is a form that needs to be submitted within the first 10 days of classes.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Oh, let me check, please wait. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Peter, thanks for waiting. I think you will automatically get in-state tuition waiver. You don’t need to do anything. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Wow! That’s great! Thank you!
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: You are welcome. Anything else?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: No, thanks, have a good day! Bye!

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, James. My name is Lisa. Glad to assist you. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, Lisa. Nice talking to you. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Nice talking to you too. What’s your inquiry?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I want to know if transfer admissions only for the fall and summer term?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: No, we have Spring transfer too. Why are you asking?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Because while browsing the transfer admissions page, there weren’t any deadlines or talk of admission for the spring term. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: So Will I be able to transfer for spring 2023?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Yes.  The deadline won’t be posted until the fall class is in. But you will have this chance in Spring 2023. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Great. Thank you.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, Masminos. This is Bob. How can I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi Bob, I applied exactly 1 month ago to Bauer & still haven’t heard back. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Let me see. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Sorry, seems I cannot fine your profile. What is your real name please?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Oh, Daniel Wong. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK. Please wait. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Daniel, thanks for waiting. I checked your application. Seems it is still in reviewing process. Have you checked with admissions office about this?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Not yet. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK. Basically it needs one month. If you haven’t heard back yet, you can call the admission office to confirm. Do you have their phone number?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Yes. I have their number. Thank you very much.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi dear Oden, this is Mary. What can I do for you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi Mary. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I applied to UH in November and got accepted, but I'm worried that my grades in AP Cal and AP Bio will put my acceptance in jeopardy.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Why do you worry about that?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I didn't manage to do well in those specific classes. I don't necessarily need them to graduate high school and I'm worried about how it will affect me. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: From what I've seen on this sub, I will only get rescinded if I don't graduate high school? I don't really know. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Ah. Don’t worry, if you can graduate high school, that will be fine. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: So it really only affects me if I don’t graduate High School?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Yes.  If you got accepted already, it won’t affect you.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Great. Thank you.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Raymond, this is Lisa. Good morning. How can I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi I’m a senior in hs, just got rejected. Checked my application status on the portal and it said I did not meet admission requirements.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I’m a little confused because UH was the one school I was certain I could get into. I have a 3.8 GPA, top 20%. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK, let me check. What’s your full name please?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Raymond Watson
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK, please wait. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Raymond, thanks for waiting. I checked that you did not submit test scores. Is this correct?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Yes. But it says the test scores are optional?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Yes. It is optional. But UH only uses core classes for test-optional admissions. I think your GPA includes electives. So after recalculation your final GPA is 2.8 which does not meet the minimal requirement for the Major you applied for. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Oh god. What should I do?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Sorry for that. I think if you want you can try to apply again for another major which does not have a very high requirement. Or you can try to forward your application to other universities. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Got it. Thank you all the same.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, David here. How can I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, I was rejected from my major for my fall 2023 application. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Yes? 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hello? Are you still there?

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Good afternoon. How can I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, I want to decline my admission. How to do that?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK. Before that would you tell me why you want to decline it?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I got admitted from UT and decide to go there. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK. Congrats. Yes you can decline your admission. Just go to the A&M portal and click the “decline” button of you admission there. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Thank you.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi there. This is Peter. What can I do for you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Jay Mark
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Want to check if I am not accepted into computer science. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Just got an email says I meet the requirements for Supply Chain & Logist T, BS
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Jay, yes I checked and you are accepted by Supply Chain & Logist T, BS as major. That was also a major selected in your application.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: How can I get to CS if I want?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Even if you aren't accepted into the major, you can still take the lower level courses while you work toward meeting the requirements to switch. If you do well on core courses then you can try to switch majors. It won’t be too hard. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Thanks sir.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hello. James here. How can I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, I have a stupid question. Do UH students get free admission to the Houston Zoo?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: ?? Yes, of course. When you got to the ticket booth, there will be a line that has a “UH student” sign. Just go there and show them your student id. They’ll check it and give you an entrance ticket.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Sounds good! What if I don’t have the Physical student ID? 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: You can get your Student ID from CougarCard office. Across the street from the Rec Center. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Or, you can also print you blackboard/acceptance letter/schedule, there will be a student ID there. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Okay perfect! Thank you so much!!

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, Adam, this is Lucas, how can I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi sir. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I have applied to the University of Houston for Masters in Computer Science as an international student on December 7th. But did not get any reply. Does this mean I am rejected? 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Oh, don’t worry. The review work has not been started yet. We usually review the applications in January. So I think you may receive a reply soon in February. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Ah, OK. Thanks for you info.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Good morning. How can I help you, Mary?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, I know that I need at least 30 hours and a 3.25 gpa to get assured admission, but what does that mean? 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Do I automatically get in when I apply or does it mean I just have a higher chance to get.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, yes, it is automatic. If you apply you will automatic get in and receive the confirmation email. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK, great. Thank you.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Daniel, what can I do for you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, I’m new here. Nice talking to you. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Nice talking to you too. What’s your inquiry? 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I’m a 12th grader and I was curious about my undergraduate chances at UH. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: These are my current stats:
•	3.578 GPA (Unweighted of course)
•	1150 (taking the SAT again)
•	Class rank: Top 28%
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: It depends of the major you are looking to be admitted into. You are on target for Exploratory studies, but a little low for engineering.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Which major are you interested in?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I am planning on applying for business
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK. I think you will be fine to enter the business college. You can check this for details: https://www.bauer.uh.edu/undergraduate/future-students/high-school/requirements.php
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Thank you. Bye. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Glad to help. Have a good day!

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, how can I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: hello. I just got an admission and will be joining uni in fall as an international student
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I want to know can i change my outstate fees to instate fees
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: or better if i can get 100% tuition off?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, I think you can try to see if you can apply for the Tier One scholarship! It's the UH full-ride scholarship program. It'll cover all your classes for four years, plus two years of the dorms and dining halls.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: You can check this link to see if you can meet the requirement: https://www.uh.edu/tieronescholars/eligibility/
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I’ll check that. Thank you very much.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hello, Peter. How can I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I was accepted into general admissions, and I have architecture as my first major.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I was told it's a 2 part process. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Will I receive another letter for my status or does my application status just change?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Yes, you’ll receive a second letter from the archsso email. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: So how should I change the status after the second email?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: After we receive your reply confirmation to that email, we will manually change your status. So please remember to reply the confirmation email. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: All right. Thank you very much.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Good morning, how may I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I am thinking to apply at UH for Fall'22, so I was wondering if you could evaluate my profile and tell me if I can get admission with this profile? Thank you!
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: University GP[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: 3.1/4 GRE: 310+ expected as I will take in Oct TOEFL: 100+ expected LoR: Strong
Intended Degree: Public Policy/ other policy related programs
Internships/work experience:
•	Research Associate at a US-based MNC ( will join from September as I'll graduate in August)
•	Research Associate at a local Research Centre ( worked part-time for 1 year and published a few reports on social & political issues)
•	Central Bank of my country (summer intern)
•	Finance Intern at a Startup (6-7 months part-time)
•	Leading NGO (volunteered for 2 years)
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi sir, you have a good GPA and extracurriculars so I think you’ll be fine. But please check the detailed requirements of the major you want to apply to. The requirement is different for different majors. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: You can visitor this link for the details: https://www.bauer.uh.edu/undergraduate/future-students/high-school/requirements.php
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: This is the undergraduate, I’m applying for graduate student. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Oh sorry, my fault. Please visit this link instead: https://www.bauer.uh.edu/graduate/future-students/high-school/requirements.php
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Thank you. And sorry for another question, I want to know if I can get a scholarship. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: No problem. You can check this link to see if you can meet the requirement: https://www.uh.edu/tieronescholars/eligibility/
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Thank you so much for the information. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: You are welcome.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Lucy, Tom here. How can I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi sir. i applied to U.H October last year and i submitted transcripts about a month ago and I’ve been waiting a while to get my admissions. How long does it usually take? 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: October Last year? Let me check. Your full name please?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Lucy Smith
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Sorry, we got multiple Lucy Smith here. Would you please tell me your email address you used in the application form please?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: My email is LSmith@gmail.com 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: All right. Lucy, I checked that your application is still in review process. Please wait in patient and I think you will receive a reply in Feb. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Great, thank you.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, David here, glad to assist. How may I help you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I was hoping to know my chances of getting into UH Honors College.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK, would you please tell me what is your SAT/GPA score?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I got a 1100 on my sat, ranked in the 1st quartile (12%, 43/354) with a 3.8 GPA
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Im in National Honor Society for my last two years of high school and was in HOSA for my freshman year and junior year and I’m currently in SkillsUSA.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Well, Your gpa and ranking are very competitive! You should be fine. It is suggested to apply for Honors College. You can do it right now.  
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK, thank you for the answer. I’ll submit the application ASAP.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, how may I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi I have a 4.0 cumulative high school gpa though and according to the admissions page, I am under “Assured admission”. I just wanted to know if this means that I am for sure guaranteed admission because I wanted to make accommodation decisions. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Have you already submitted the application or not?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: No. Not yet. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Oh and I want to apply without test scores because my test scores are like 5 years old (I’m 21, old freshman)
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Well, Are you in the Top 10 percent? This is a new policy. If you’re top 10% you have auto admission with or without test for any public university in Texas.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I’m in the top 20%, I think I will fall under the “assured admission” category.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I just wanted to make sure that the admission is guaranteed before I signed an apartment lease or anything. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Well, I believe you will. But it depends on the majors you select. You can try to apply it first ,then you will receive an email soon if you are “assured admission”. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Thanks for that.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hello Charles. Linda here. How may I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi it is about my scholarship. Can I mail a scholarship check to financial aid office? 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: How was the process and how long did it take to show up on my account?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: I believe you need to go in person to the Financial Aid office to drop off the check. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Thanks so much, I was about to mail it out ??.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, how can I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Do UH give scholarships on spring?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Sorry, currently we don’t have scholarship on Spring. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Oh. OK. Thanks.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hello Elia, what can I do for you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I have a strange problem. My friends have their scholarships applied directly to tuition. But mine are given as refunds instead of being applied directly to my tuition.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Idk Why is that?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Did you pay your tuition before you get the scholarship?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Yes. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK, so this is why the scholarship changed to refund. Because you paid the total balance before the scholarship had the chance to disburse into your account.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Oh. So I shouldn’t do that?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: No. Don't pay the tuition in advance next time. You can do a payment plan with about three mouse clicks in AccessUH, then when the scholarships disburse the payment plan is paid with them. Your bank account, etc. Is never involved.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Ah, got it. Thank you very much.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, Nancy, what can I do for you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, I want to check my scholarship status. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: apparently other people have already received their academic excellence scholarships, but i never got one:(
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK, please wait, let me check. You full name is Nancy Brown, right?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Yes. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Please wait. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, Nancy, I checked that your application is still in review. Please be patient. And don’t worry since your grades are pretty good, you will surely receive the AES. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK, that will be fine. Thank you.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, Peter. My name is David. How can I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi David. im an international student, i have been facing a hard time to pay this years tuition, im looking for scholarships from the university or any organization that can help me pay. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK. There are quite a few international scholarships. You can check out scholarship universe on your access uh. Some of the deadlines may have already passed for this year though. ??
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Oh, haven’t thought that. Thank you very much.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hello, how can I help you sir?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, it is about AES. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I just got $6k/yr. I wonder if this was the max amount?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, it depends on year. But yes, it is the max amount this year and I think it can cover your full tuition. Congrats. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Alright, thank you.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, what can I do for you?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi, when do the high school apps for class of 2024 start?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: it normally opens up around August 1st, 2023. Apply as quickly as you can so you can receive a decision and be prioritized for scholarships.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK, thank you for the info.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: No problem. Any other question?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: No. Thank you. Have a good day.  
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Thanks and you too.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi there, how can I help you ?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Hi. I am currently doing the application to become an sep assist and was wondering how much they make in scholarships.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: OK, let me see, please wait. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi, I checked that it makes $2000. 
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: OK. Thank you very much.

[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Nash: Hi Dally, this is Lisa, how can I help you today?
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: I want to know how competitive is the tier one scholarship. I'm an in state applicant.
[2023/06/01 16:31:17]:Visitor: Here are my stats:
1490 SAT (800 EBRW, 690 Math)
4.0 GPA Unweighted; Homeschooled (with 7 dual enrollment classes)
Extracurriculars:
Community College Philosophy Club President (won't list the community college)
Community College Accounting Club Member
Competitive Swimming
Competitive Soccer
Homeschool Book Club Founder
150 Volunteer Hours
